required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Evaluate Safety and Efficacy of Jaktinib in Adults With Alopecia Areata
clinical_study.official_title: A Multi-center, Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled Phase III Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Jaktinib in Adult Patients With Severe Alopecia Areata

brief_summary.textblock: This is a multi-center Phase 3 study to evaluate the safety and effectiveness of an investigational study drug (called Jaktinib) in adults (≥18 years and <65 years) who have 50% or greater scalp hair loss. The study is placebo-controlled, meaning that some patients entering the study will not receive active study drug but will receive tablets with no active ingredients (a placebo). It is double-blinded, meaning that the Sponsor, the study doctors, the staff, and the patients will not know whether a patient is on active study drug (or the dose) or placebo.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Achieving Severity of Alopecia Tool (SALT) ≤ 20
primary_outcome.description: SALT is a quantitative assessment of scalp hair loss with scores ranging from 0 (no scalp hair loss) to 100 (complete scalp hair loss).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Achieving 50% Improvement of SALT (SALT50)

arm_group.description: Jaktinib administered orally. Placebo administered orally to maintain the blind.
Jaktinib administered orally. Placebo administered orally to maintain the blind.

overall_official.affiliation: Hospital for skin diseases, Chinese Academy of Medical Sciences
